body: I can repro consistently and can't go through a full sync. Happy to provide additional logs / debug. FYI even reducing to 1 transfer / 1 checker at a time doesn't resolve it. Just tested with beta and still happening.
Looking into it, I'm thinking this probably relates to how we use the return of srv.Call() Other services using REST pass both resp and err to a shouldRetry which actually checks for resp != nil
Line 257 (per the trace): not impossible for err != nil but resp is. Not a Go expert, but will try to play with it later.

@lostb1t curious for your thoughts as it seems you're the original contributor (congrats!). As mentioned, I'm not the most familiar with Go but considering we are consistently experiencing SIGSEV on line 256 of drive.go I'm considering we should check for resp != nil as the underlying REST provider may not guarantee it

Issue solved. I also think that I potentially solved another potential issue here. My understanding is that currently most files may end up being downloaded twice (lines 254 and 266), except when an error appears on 255. Will run a full sync tomorrow and open a pull request. Would love the OP review.

issue.title: Update iclouddrive drive.go

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

* Fixing SIGSEGV https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8211
* Removed files potentially downloaded twice

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

body:
FYI now that we are passing this error, here's what happens occasionally: 
Failed to copy: failed to open source object: RootURL not set

I also have this problem syncing thousands (20k+) files. Tested on Debian 12, Ubuntu Server 24.04 LTS, Ubuntu Server 25.04 and FreeBSD 14. All of them running rclone v1.69.2.

```
rclone v1.69.2
- os/version: ubuntu 25.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.14.0-15-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.24.2
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```

@prrar I merged a fix for this to master just now. Please give it 30 minutes then try [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/)
 - thanks.
@ncw that worked fine, thank you very much! 200k files and no crashes.
